page.title: 04BRAISHFIELD CHURCHES
page.content: The Anglican Church of All Saints, situated in the centre of the village, was erected in 1854 by public subscription,and consecrated in 1855. The roof was restored in 1945, and a modern organ was installed in 1955 to commemorate the centenary. It is part of the united benefice of Michelmersh, Timsbury, Farley Chamberlayne and Braishfield, the present incumbent being Rev.D.Bruce Kington, who resides at the rectory at Braishfield. Four hangings in modern embroidery hang in the Church. The altar kneelers record the names of past rectors.There are 53 members on the electoral roll. The United Reformed Church was built in 1818, and is administered from the parent Church in Romsey, who are waiting the appointment of a new minister.There are 10 adult church members,and 10 junior church members.
